image.altText: Six different hands reach towards a contactless pay point on public transport, each paying in a different way.

props.synopsis: A new ticketing system called MyWay+ will be introduced tomorrow for Canberra public transport, which allows users to tap on with certain contactless bank cards or by scanning a QR code in the new app.

title.children: Public transport set for big changes from tomorrow as MyWay+ is launched

image.altText: The exterior of a white marble court building.

props.synopsis: A Canberra corrections officer is denied bail after allegedly attacking a man through his car window, pulling him out of the window and further assaulting him, then attempting to run him over in a car.

title.children: Corrections officer allegedly attacked man and tried to run him down after weeks of threats, court hears

image.altText: A concrete building reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory", with Australian, ACT and Aboriginal flag.

props.synopsis: A former Canberra teacher facing charges of alleged child sex abuse dating back to the 1990s is banned from going near any schools or being in the presence of children without an adult present.

title.children: Former Canberra teacher facing child sexual abuse charges barred from going near schools

image.altText: A man wearing a checked shirt standing in a vineyard.

props.synopsis: At Mount Majura Vineyard on the edge of Canberra, viticulturalist James Hopper is planting new grape varieties that can better cope with the effects of a changing climate.

title.children: Canberra winemakers planting new grape varieties that could become the wines of the future

image.altText: The front of a police station building

props.synopsis: Senior Constable Brett David Lindsay pleads not guilty to six assault charges relating to alleged incidents while he was on duty on the NSW far south coast.

title.children: NSW police officer pleads not guilty to assaulting multiple teenagers and a woman while on duty

image.altText: A concrete building with lettering above the entrance reading "Law Courts of the Australian Capital Territory".

props.synopsis: The suspected pipe bomb was allegedly found behind the dishwasher of the man's former marital home.

title.children: Man who threatened ex-partner with alleged pipe bomb and napalm denied bail

image.altText: Four younger women and non-binary people lean against a wall.

props.synopsis: After deciding to form a band while watching School of Rock, the band have won an ARIA award and shared the stage with Pearl Jam in the same week.

title.children: From a year 9 Canberra sleepover to sharing a stage with Pearl Jam: The rise of Teen Jesus and the Jean Teasers

image.altText: A machete and a sheath lying on a table.

props.synopsis: A 30-year-old Canberra man has lost a bid for bail, after he was charged with attempted murder in the wake of an alleged machete attack in September.

title.children: Man who allegedly severed victim's fingers in machete attack refused bail in Canberra

image.altText: Steve wearing a black polo looking at the camera

props.synopsis: Two Indigenous former NSW Police officers tell the ABC the force's overtly racist culture is contributing to the increasingly high incarceration rate of First Nations people.

title.children: Former Indigenous NSW Police officers allege they were forced out of job

image.altText: Malarndirri McCarthy is in parliament house holding a piece of paper

props.synopsis: The Albanese government tables their response to the landmark two-year inquiry into missing and murdered First Nations women.

title.children: $194 million in support to end domestic violence suffered by First Nations victims

image.altText: Steve Smith and Pat Cummins sit in the dug out with their pads on before play

props.synopsis: The scale of Australia's defeat in the first Test against India has left us all searching for answers, and means careers will be put on the line in Adelaide and beyond.

title.children: Horror Perth Test defeat means Australia's future will be defined by what happens next

image.altText: Chalmers looks serious as he stares out of frame.

props.synopsis: The federal budget is sliding deeper into the red, Treasurer Jim Chalmers has confirmed, with next month's mid-year budget update to show a larger deficit than had been expected in May.

title.children: Economists warn mid-year federal budget to land with thud as good fortune runs out

image.altText: A banner out the front of a brick building that says 'KU Children's Services'

props.synopsis: A childcare operator was given the power to allocate more than half a billion dollars in federal funding set aside for children with disabilities, without any public record of how the money was spent.

title.children: Government allowed private organisation to hand out more than $500m of public money

image.altText: Anthony Albanese shakes hands with people wearing camo.

props.synopsis: Tender documents reveal the Australian Submarine Agency awarded the lucrative AUKUS contract to the local subsidiary of McKinsey & Company last month.

title.children: Documents reveal consultancy firm contracted to $9 million AUKUS deal has Chinese military ties

image.altText: Greens party members Max Chandler-Mather and Adam Bandt at a press conference.

props.synopsis: Party leader Adam Bandt says the Greens had pushed "as hard as they can" for Labor to go further, but would support the bills without amendment.

title.children: Greens to hand Labor win on two key housing bills after lengthy stand-off

image.altText: The unidentifiable hands of three people hold video game controllers.

props.synopsis: Australians spent $4.4 billion on video gaming last year, but finding information on how best to spend their money is challenging.

title.children: Australian gaming journalism has 'pretty well evaporated' and video game creators say that's a problem

image.altText: Sunrise at Woonona Point NSW

props.synopsis: A severe weather warning is in place across eastern NSW until Thursday, with temperatures expected to soar up to 12 degrees Celsius above average.

title.children: Residents across eastern NSW to swelter in 'first significant heatwave of season'

image.altText: _Khrystyna_Ukraine

props.synopsis: With evidence of war crimes emerging from occupied areas of Ukraine throughout Russia's full-scale invasion, there are fears for the fate of civilians if Trump-negotiated peace talks involve ceding territory.

title.children: Fears for Ukrainians in occupation areas if peace negotiations involve ceding territory to Russia

image.altText: A sombre-looking man standing behind a microphone, next to a USA flag.

props.synopsis: As Pacific leaders talk of an "Ocean of Peace", nations continue to sign up to defence pacts with the US, as concerns mount about China's growing military interests across the region.

title.children: 'There is an agenda': The US and Fiji have signed a new defence deal, so what does it mean for peace in the Pacific?

image.altText: Golden coins with the Bitcoin logo on it are pictured.

props.synopsis: Cryptocurrency devotees are riding the recent crypto wave fuelled by Donald Trump's re-election in the US. But Australian industry figures says businesses and consumers are being let down by a lack of regulation.

title.children: Trump's election has started a fresh boom for Bitcoin, but Australian crypto regulations haven't caught up

image.altText: A man stands on a beach holiding a bright yellow surfcraft.

props.synopsis: Erectile dysfunction affects one in three Australian men aged over 40 at least once a week, but it is rarely talked about.

title.children: 'I wasn't giving up sex': How Doug navigated erectile dysfunction after prostate cancer diagnosis

image.altText: Team members Alanna Kennedy, Hayley Raso celebrating on field after a goal

props.synopsis: The Matildas will play their first game against Brazil in a series of friendlies against Brazil and Chinese Taipei this week.

title.children: The Matildas will kick off a series of friendly matches this week in Australia. Here's how to watch

image.altText: A close-up of a knee of a middle-aged man being held in a wrinkled hand as they sit on a bench.

props.synopsis: Researchers have calculated the greenhouse gas impact for a single knee replacement in a Melbourne hospital is equivalent to a 914-kilometre car trip.

title.children: Knee replacement surgery emits as much carbon as driving a car from Sydney to Brisbane

image.altText: An image of Scott Rush, Matthew Norman, Chen Si-Yi, Martin Stephens, and Michael Czugaj

props.synopsis: In 2005, nine Australians were arrested in Indonesia over a heroin smuggling plot. Only one of them returned home to Australia.

title.children: The young Australians who became known as the Bali Nine

image.altText: Two red and white ships break through an icy body of water.

props.synopsis: The icebreakers have been invited to expand their use of Hobart as part of a push by the Tasmanian government to capitalise on China's growing interest in Antarctica.

title.children: As China expands its Antarctic operations, Tasmania is trying to lure its icebreakers back to Hobart

image.altText: A female judge in a court room.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory coroner has delivered her findings and recommendations from a landmark coronial inquiry into the domestic violence killings of four Aboriginal women in the territory. She's also announced she'll hold a second major inquiry into the issue.

title.children: NT coroner details 'extent of horror' in landmark DV inquest findings

image.altText: A white yacht on sea

props.synopsis: Sixteen people including 12 foreign nationals are missing after a tourist boat sank off Egypt's Red Sea coast.

title.children: More than a dozen missing after tourist yacht sinks off Egypt's coast in Red Sea

image.altText: Matthew Richardson of Australia displays his silver medal on an Olympic podium

props.synopsis: Australia's track cycling defector Matthew Richardson has avoided a two-year ban from competition after his acrimonious decision to race for Great Britain.

title.children: 'He acted in a way which conflicted with our values': Australian cycling defector Matthew Richardson slammed, but avoids two-year ban

image.altText: People gather around an area covered in flames and smoke.

props.synopsis: Security officials say they expect between 9,000 and 11,000 demonstrators while Imran Khan's party claims the number will be much higher.

title.children: One killed, dozens injured in Pakistan clashes with Imran Khan supporters

image.altText: A man between large rocks in a river holds on to one end of a yellow rope

props.synopsis: A rescue team faced with a terrible decision, complicated by a language barrier and unthinkable challenges, such as 13 tonnes of water per second to deal with. How did they save a man trapped for more than 20 hours in a river?

title.children: Thirteen tonnes of water per second: Why rescuers were forced to cut a man's leg off in Tasmania

image.altText: pink fireworks in darkness over ocean

props.synopsis: Tourism operators have expressed dismay after the Sunshine Coast Council scrapped its traditional midnight fireworks display.

title.children: Popular holiday region criticised for cancelling midnight NYE fireworks

image.altText: Lando Norris, Charlec Leclerc, Max Verstappen in their F1 cars racing each other

props.synopsis: The drivers' championship has been wrapped up for a fourth time by Red Bull's Max Verstappen, but the fight for Formula 1's constructors' crown is poised for a thrilling conclusion.

title.children: McLaren, Ferrari and Red Bull battle for F1 constructors' championship

image.altText: A generic stock photo of a group of teenage school girls on their phones, wearing formal school uniforms.

props.synopsis: The government is rushing to get its laws banning children under 16 from social media through parliament before the end of the week, with a senate inquiry open for submissions for just one day.

title.children: After Elon Musk weighed in on the social media age ban, parliament was flooded with 15,000 submissions

image.altText: A woman wearing a long sleeved pink and khaki top stands in the House of Representatives.

props.synopsis: Two ministers invoke the name of their late colleague Peta Murphy to offer contradictory views on why the government's gambling advertising restrictions have been delayed.

title.children: Gambling ad ban delays prompt fury in parliament and contradictions among ministers

image.altText: Carissa smiles softly over her shoulder while standing on a beach, wearing a khaki singlet, red hair falling in waves

props.synopsis: Carissa Broadbent wasn't loving her first "big-girl job in corporate America", so she decided to try writing a romantasy book. Now she's a best-selling author.

title.children: Many people fantasise about quitting their jobs to write romantasy but Carissa Broadbent actually did it
